author: Daltin Brown

text: I love super mario
author: Daltin Brown

text: I got Super Mario All-Stars & Super Mario World in a bundle with the SNES when I was still very young. It was also my first videogame, so I wasn't any good at the games. But despite this, or maybe because of this, I have very strong memories for this title theme (and also the other title themes such as the one for SMB 3), because I'd watch the title screen demo animation a lot and gaze admiringly at how the game was supposed to be played. So many powerful memories come rushing back while listening to this tune, after all these years. Thanks for uploading. : )
author: LordMyoo

text: still the greatest mario game.  Its not the popular choice (SMB3 for 2d, M64 for 3d), but it is.  Ill here an argument for the genius that is SMB, but SMW...easily the best.

author: WhiteVII

text:
I've beaten NSMB for the NDS and the one for the Wii. They are both easy, but I had problems in the last 2-3 levels in the Wii version. And no, I'm not inexperienced. 
NSMB games don't come near SMW or SMB3, but I still find them fun. Mediocre, but still fun to play, especially the Wii version in multiplayer.

text:
XFD I'm currently replaying this game, and just last Saturday I beat the levels "Tubular", "Way Cool", and "Awesome" for the first time ever.  It took me 2 hours and 15 minutes to beat all three of those levels.

But yeah, not at all hard for me to see why this game is so highly regarded.

author: darkseid1321

text:
Oh man. The feels I feel when hearing this theme.
I remember hearing this and being so hyped for an hour of fun and adventure. I remember playing this game with my mum. I remember walking across the world, exploring and replaying levels just for the hell of it. I remember the holes my fantasy filled in, you know, the little stories kids make up, about secrets, and special techniques, about power ups that might or might not exist. About the meaning of life hidden just behind the goal post.

<3

text: My sister had an NES, but come Christmas of 1994, I'd get my first console, the SNES with this game and Super Mario All Stars.  Totally agree with you on the exits!  I didn't find Soda Lake until ten years later when I learned of the exit.

text: This game is amazing! Not sure what I like more, this or Super Mario Bros 3.
author: Name

text:
This game aged perfectly, the graphic is timeless and gameplay still top notch.
And i don`t know why, but the overworld feels way better in this game than in any other Mario title including the ones on Wii/3DS/WiiU.
author: AdlerSchwadron

text: The first SNES game I ever played, and what a game it was! A true classic, it's also one of my favorite 2D platformers of all time. I find Super Mario World perfectly challenging and I love how there are tons of secret paths/short cuts. I just feel like smiling the whole time I'm playing it, especially with Kondo's charming soundtrack. Dinosaur Land is still my favorite Mario map, I wish we'd see a return of the dinosaurs in new Mario games!
author: SupraDarky
